item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Also note: my bad - must have had a filter on: ​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=263

item.title: Ticket #529 (Markup for linking from one post to another) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Plugin? Yes - see link in description and notes in Additional information. I don't doubt that there are other implementations as well.

As for the core: Make it as simple as possible. But no simpler.

If enough people want a feature, it should be standard. I imagine there are exceptions to this sweeping generality, but I think good soft linking is a valuable feature. Whether or not enough people agree with me, I don't know. I do, however, think most people link from post to post; these links should be made as robust as possible, thereby eliminating difficult support issues down the road ("I have to do _what_ with MySQL?")

item.title: Ticket #534 (Users can access wp-config.php from the template edition page) created

item.description: Users can access the wp-config.php file from the template edition page in the administration. This way, unauthorized users can have access to the mysql server, if it have an external port open.

item.title: Ticket #95 (Link owner not displayed anywhere.) updated
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
Reminder sent to tormodh

Hi, I hope you are the user (tormodh) who logs in as tor at the mosquito. With regards to issue #95, I called it a "minor" issue instead of a "feature" issue since I beleive that a feature is when a request is made for a new feature in wordpress, like, say an in-built mailing list. Just wanted to send you a note to say it maybe better to reserve "feature" for such bugs. (I am not reverting to to "minor", let this be the way it is.)

Please refer to ​http://manual.mantisbt.org/manual.page.descriptions.view.bugs.page.php (please try to use the descriptions here and in other pages in the manual while triaging.)

...and, for a more real-world practical use example ​http://www.debian.org/Bugs/Developer#severities

:) Have a great day!

Carthik ( mail@… )

item.title: Ticket #94 (Using blockquote in a post breaks the nesting order of the p tag) updated
item.dc:creator: tor
item.description:
Reproduced this today accidently in 1.2.1

To clarify since it looks like white space and p tags were eaten by mosquito...

Posting something to the effect of

"lorem ipsum [blockquote]fooboomooshooblockquote

is the best"

should yield

"lorem ipsump[blockquote]fooboomooshooblockquote [p]is the bestp"

OR

"lorem ipsum[blockquote]fooboomooshooblockquotep [p]is the bestp"

Instead this gets rendered which is invalid for nesting reasons. Also, the br tag shouldn't be inserted.

"[p]lorem ipsum[br /] [blockquote]fmoobommoopblockquote

[p]s the best

p"

item.title: Ticket #531 (Post slug is set when draft is saved, not when published) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #531 (Post slug is set when draft is saved, not when published) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: When you save a draft, or click "Advanced Editing" (which saves a draft), the post slug is set, based on the title at that point. If the title is then changed, and the post is published, the post slug remains what it was before. I see no reason we can't wait until the post is published before setting the slug. There's no URI to break... it's a draft.

item.title: Ticket #529 (Markup for linking from one post to another) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #529 (Markup for linking from one post to another) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
I know this feature has been requested before (example: ​http://wordpress.org/support/3/17546 ), and I also know the developers probably have more important things to work on.

That said, it'd be great to have a markup tag available when writing posts that would create soft links from one post to another. Something like:

<wp-link post-id="ID#">a different post</wp-link>

And a filter added to the_content that would convert that markup into a link at runtime. That way, only markup involving the post ID would be saved in the database so if the site url/permalinking structure changed in the future, all the internal post->post links would still work.

item.title: Ticket #169 (get_links_list() in wp-includes/links.php ignores $text_after_link settings) updated
item.dc:creator: Froosh
item.description:
Ok, that makes sense.

Should this instead be a request that wp-sidebar use wp_get_links() rather than get_links_list()?

From a user-experience point of view it's very frustrating when changing the settings in Link Categories and seeing zero change in the site.

I would prefer see the link separators stay and be implemented rather than be removed altogether. Not that I'm even using them at the moment... :)
